poem:
### At Co-op Live

In the pulse of Manchester night,  
crowds gather, shadows dance—  
Springsteen's chords, a river flowing,  
no empty seats,  
the air electric, they sing as one.  
A promise kept,  
despite whispered doubts,  
music surges,  
bringing light—  
a storm captured,  
in sound and spirit,  
a memory sealed,  
alive,  
alive.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From early setbacks to a storming Springsteen show: Co-op Live, a year on When Bruce Springsteen opened his European tour at Manchester’s Co-op Live arena on Wednesday night, it went off without a hitch. Thousands of fans belted out the lyrics to Dancing in the Dark with not an empty seat in sight, and the show was met with glowing reviews. But some had thought The Boss’s appearance might never happen. The venue, the largest". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
